item.title: Shovel Knight Dev’s Fate Depends on Mina the Hollower’s Success
item.content:encoded:
Shovel Knight developers have revealed that Mina the Hollower is going to be their ‘make or break’ moment.

A new report by Bloomberg’s Jason Schreier reveals that Shovel Knight dev, Yacht Club Games, might be in trouble if their next title, Mina the Holler, doesn’t perform well. For those unaware, Mina the Hollower was delayed indefinitely last month, just weeks before its previous release date.

Mina the Hollower’s Performance Can Make or Break It for Them

The new report first describes how the developers invited Schreier over to showcase their title, only for the conference room to fill with smoke. The game was still demoed after, to show where the developers stand at the moment and why they have to delay the game further.

The report reveals that only in the past weeks has the game reached a point where the Shovel Knight developers were able to play all the content from start to end. During this process, they have identified several areas that need improvement. However, they have only identified all the problems and will need some more time to fix them.

Shovel Knight developers can only remain independent if Mina the Hollower is a success. The dev studio has already undergone downsizing and now has only 15 employees left, with finances at a low point as well. The co-founder, Sean Velasco, has stated, “It’s make-or-break for sure,” adding that if the game sells 500,000 copies, they are golden; if it sells 200,000, they are still happy; however, if they sell only 100,000, that could be a problem.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Gets 13 Games in December 2025
item.content:encoded:
Xbox Game Pass game additions for December 2025 have been revealed, and we are receiving 13 new games this month.

A new month has arrived, which means new titles will be added to all subscription services. We already know which games are leaving Game Pass in December 2025, and now we have been informed about the games that will be added this month. Lost Records: Bloom & Rage was added in December as well, and is available today.

Xbox Game Pass Adds Mortal Kombat 1, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle and More in December 2025

Starting with the first title, Monster Train 2 will be available for cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S on December 3. On the same day, Spray Paint Simulator will be added for cloud, console, and PC. On December 4, Game Pass will add a game preview for 33 Immortals on cloud, console, and PC, and also Indiana Jones and the Great Circle for cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S. Another game that will be added on December 4 is Routine, a Day One release for cloud, console, handheld, and PC.

Moving onto December 9, Game Pass will add A Game About Digging a Hole to cloud, handheld, PC, and Xbox Series X/S. Death Howl will be added for handheld and PC on the same day and is a Day One release. The third and final title being added on December 9 is Dome Keeper, and it will be available for cloud, console, handheld, and PC.

On December 10, the big one: Mortal Kombat 1 is added to cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S. Bratz: Rhythm & Style will follow on December 11 and will be available on cloud, console, and PC. Moreover, Stellaris, World War Z: Aftermath, and Medieval Dynasty will be added for Game Pass Essential on December 3. Readers can check out the official blog for more details.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Players Can Now Buy & Gift Items Directly From Discord
item.content:encoded:
Discord is rolling out a new commerce experience for users and has partnered with Marvel Rivals as the first title with integrated shopping and gifting.

Launching just in time for the Marvel Rivals anniversary celebrations and the holiday season, players in the Marvel Rivals Discord will be able to browse and purchase digital goods within the Marvel Rivals Discord.

Players in the Marvel Rivals Discord can now create a wishlist of the items they want to add to their collection and gift in-game items to their friends, with purchased and gifted items instantly accessible within Marvel Rivals.

Discord says the integration is a huge boost for players and developers alike, as gifting isn’t limited to players of the game, so items can be gifted to friends to encourage them to jump into the game, extending in-game currency, and building upon the existing gifting behavior on Discord.

It’s added that 20% of all Shop purchases on Discord are gifts, a number that increases to almost 30% during the holiday season, so the integration is described as “a natural evolution of how people use Discord to connect and celebrate together.”

Initially, the integration will support purchases in USD only on the Discord desktop client, though players from the US, Canada, Ireland, and Oceania will be able to use it. Additional regions and platform support will be explored in the future, Discord says.

Additional game support is expected to be added in the future as part of the feature’s evolution.

item.title: Six Games Are Leaving Xbox Game Pass This December
item.content:encoded:
It has been confirmed that six games will leave Xbox Game Pass in December 2025, including Hollow Knight.

Xbox Game Pass receives a new set of games each month across two waves. The first wave for December 2025 has not yet been announced; however, the games leaving this month have already been confirmed. In the meantime, check out the nine games that were added in November Wave 2, including The Crew Motorfest, Lost Records: Bloom & Rage, and more.

Hollow Knight and More Removed from Xbox Game Pass in December 2025

As mentioned above, the big title leaving Xbox Game Pass in December 2025 is Hollow Knight, specifically the Voidheart Edition. This edition offers players the original award-winning adventure, along with four content packs that expand the game with new quests, boss fights, and abilities.

The next big game that is leaving Xbox Game Pass in December is Mortal Kombat 11, the last title before the whole universe was reborn. The other four titles that will be removed from the service this month are Wildfrost, Paw Patrol World, Cataclismo, and Still Wakes the Deep. Players should note that the last date to play these games through Xbox Game Pass is December 16, 2025.

In other news, here’s a guide on how you can claim Fortnite Crew with the help of Xbox Game Pass Ultimate.
